data.title: Clear output console (Button + clear on Play)
data.body:
This PR resolves Feature #1825 
- Added a "Clear" button above output console
- Added a Setting option to automatize clearing when Play is started

data.title: MSAA support in 3D
data.body:
Currently, it is only possible to enable FXAA (Fast approXimate Anti-Aliasing) in 3D. Drivers can request a slower but prettier anti-aliasing, that has been done for years now: Multi-Sample Anti-Aliasing.

MSAA is slower, but looks sharper and doesn't "blur" the image like FXAA does. It however does not work on transparent textures. For this, you would need SSAA (SuperSample Anti-Aliasing) which is very slow.

This should be fairly easy to do.

data.title: Physic Body Instanced scene doesn't use CollisionShapes
data.body:
When instancing a PhysicBody2D node (don't know if this is true for 3d as well) the new CollisionShape or CollisionPolygon nodes added as childs of the instanced scene are not used for the collisions.

This is the hierachy:

```
main_node
    - other nodes
    - instanced RigidBody2D
        - ... (other child nodes saved inside RigidBody2D)
        - CollisionShape2D (new node added to the instanced scene, does not work)
```

I think this is useful in a lot of ways, but it also follows the whole idea of "instanced scenes". Besides if it works with other nodes, why not with collision shapes?

Here's a test project: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/274954519/instance_scene_collision_test.zip

data.title: [wiki] Replace SceneTree with get_tree()
data.body:
Was just trying to figure out how to control the spread of input events, found this:
https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/tutorial_input_events
But it uses the `SceneTree` class, which didn't work in my code (throws `inexistent function in base GDNativeClass`). After half an hour figured out you have to use `get_tree()` to use `set_input_as_handled()`

Suggesting replacement of `SceneTree` to `get_tree()` on that page, or annotating that you have to use it to get the instance of the tree instead of using the class

data.title: AshelyCPP for game entities
data.body:
Hey everyone. 

While using LibGDX I have played around with a very unique and simple entity framework called Ashley. It makes adding entities to the game much more simple and straightforward.  See here https://github.com/libgdx/ashley and here https://github.com/libgdx/ashley/wiki/Framework-overview and here as well https://github.com/libgdx/ashley/wiki/How-to-use-Ashley

I find Ashley fits very  well with Godot's modular approach. Ashley makes it easier to add actors and items (objects) to the game. 

There is a port of Ashley for C++ here https://github.com/SgtCoDFish/AshleyCPP 

Would be nice to add AshleyCPP into Godot. You could add an Ashley class to Godot and make it usable from GDScript.  The normal way is to code each unit individually but with Ashley you only code unique properties (called components) and assign those properties to an entity. You could even add an Entity node in the engine that you can tag it with properties you defined.  You can also update properties dynamically making all affected entities update as well rather than iterating trough entities. You get much more control and more streamlined code. You can also create entity families like races, factions, classes etc. 

I guess I'm thinking this more of a plugin than a core feature.

data.title: Download files at runtime via HTTP
data.body: It is necessary to add a new HTTP load mode ...

data.title: GDScript debugger does not allow setting and removing breakpoints while engine is running.
Colored console output
data.body:
In an UNIX terminal, you can type this for example:

``` Shell
echo -e "\e[31;1mRed Bold Text"
```

However, this doesn't work in Godot, the sequence will be output as plain text:

``` GDScript
print("\\e[31;1mRed Bold Text")
```

(There are two backslashes in order to actually print one backslash.)

It doesn't work with `printraw()` either.

Either the sequences should be supported, or, better, there should be a cross-platform way of colouring console output, as Windows supports a subset of console colours too. Possible uses are:
- Highlighting errors and warnings
- Easier to read logs

data.title: Subscenes not re-importing properly.
data.body: Made changes in subscene. Changes were not accurately reflected in the Project that referenced the subscene. Tried to use the Re-Import option and nothing happened. When I closed Godot and then reopened Godot everything imported corrected. This can be a nuisance to have to keep closing and opening Godot.

data.title: Fixed the mouse position for control when it is in a canvas_layer.
data.body:
At control.cpp 1108:

```
  Matrix32 localizer = (get_canvas_transform()).affine_inverse();
  Size2 pos = localizer.xform(Size2(p_event.mouse_motion.x,p_event.mouse_motion.y));
```

In the before version, we get a wrong mouse position  when control is in a CanvasLayer.
I see mouse position is converted  via get_canvas_transform(), so I modified the get_canvas_transform method.

data.title: 3D issues
data.body:
3D is very hard to use until these issues are fixed:
- Color alpha values are not preserved https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/issues/2268
- ~~~exporter writes absolute paths to images into .dae even if told to copy images https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/issues/2247 (fix exists)~~~ fixed
- AnemationTreePlayer's doesn't reset non-looping animations, so they are not displayed correctly https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/issues/2199

data.title: [AudioServer] Changing global fx volume doesn't affect the reverb of SamplePlayers
data.body:
When using a SamplePlayer that has ReverbSend, using the function:
_AudioServer.set_fx_global_volume_scale(0)_
will reduce the volume of the sample that is played, but the sound will still be sent to the reverb and only the 'echo' will be heard.

[Sample project](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/43859429/ReverbBug.zip)

data.title: GDScript: Parent variables aren't accessible in sub classes
data.body:
Put in another way, sub classes seem to be instanced in a separate scope from the main class.

Example script showing the issue: http://pastebin.com/wSF6bxhY

Expected output: "Hello World"
Actual output: Parse error: Identifier not found: global_var

data.title: Fixes compile bug for Android template on Windows.
data.body:
Update to compiling Android on Windows.

After much testing these version numbers and file links seemed to work for me.
1. Install Java SDK 6. Can be found at.
   http://download.oracle.com/otn-pub/java/java_ee_sdk/6u4/java_ee_sdk-6u4-jdk-windows-x64.exe?AuthParam=1437511929_e3d8ec6a4c6908ab727d2323a640cf67
2. Install latest Android-SDK.
   https://dl.google.com/android/installer_r24.3.3-windows.exe
   
   Using the SDK Manager.
   Install Android 4.4.2 API & Android 4.0.3 API
   Install Android SDK Build-Tools 19.1
   You may need to prune stuff so all you have is the above.
3. Install Android-NDK 9b.
   https://dl.google.com/android/ndk/android-ndk-r9b-windows-x86_64.zip
4. Install Apache Ant version 1.9.2
   http://archive.apache.org/dist/ant/binaries/

Previous documentation seemed to be accurate for the most part.

Make sure that the CommandPrompt window is Run As Administrator. Or things will crash.

"C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 12.0\VC\vcvarsall.bat" needs to be run so that platforms other than Android can be detected.

Pull request is required for this process to work.

data.title: New RegEx library
data.body:
I've finally managed to port over the improved regex library and included a regex tester in the demo files. I'm not entirely sure how much of the script-side API I've changed but I tried to keep it as close as possible to ease the transition.

https://github.com/leezh/nrex

This was discussed in Issue #2230 and should fix most of the issues people had with the old trex library.

data.title: AnimationTreePlayer blending normal tracks
data.body:
AnimationTreePlayer works fine when blending the animations that uses transform tracks. Unfortunately these tracks are not easy to modify (there is no auto insert track or insert key as in normal tracks) and there's no way to use this tracks in 2d (or at least I think so).

I've made a project testing the blending of two animations (horizontal & vertical) using normal and transform tracks in 2d and 3d.

I don't know if this conversion from transform to normal tracks blending is gonna take a while (I think the transform tracks are older than the normal tracks and the Tween utility  ?), but this could be a nice thing to have in the animation modules. 

Basically this:
[![IMAGE ALT TEXT HERE](http://img.youtube.com/vi/BYZuVQlFpko/0.jpg)](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BYZuVQlFpko)

Here's the project: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/274954519/animation-tree-tests.zip

and add fa (persian) locale.

data.title: When I finish the choice of Joint's nodeA/B,the dialog of Assign/Clear doesn't gone.
One way collisions are unstable -> Character falls through
data.body:
One way collisions worked once good for me. After this commit I had problems: https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/commit/32b1b472af379b3ea3b155a38158f08aed1e92e1

Now my character falls often through the collider. I have a moving platform that can float. Once It starts moving the character falls immediately through.

I send you an email a while back with my project which had the problem. Would be great if this could be fixed again :-)

data.title: add option to center window
data.body:
This adds the option to start the game centered (display/center). There is an existing function when running from the editor but not for exported games. This adds that.

~~Also, replaced XMapWindow with XMapRaised~~

data.title: Improve export validation
data.body: A couple of improvements to the export dialog and validation.

data.title: X11 boot screen fills window when maximized
data.body: In X11 if the engine launches in maximized mode the boot screen will not fill the window. This fixes that bug.

data.title: Godot over Remote Desktop crashes
data.body:
If I try yo start a Godot session over RD, it crashes. If I open a session in the remote machine and access it over RD, it works, until I try running a scene.

As per VS Debugger: 

> Excepcin no controlada en 0x7753883d en godot_win64-1.1stable.exe: 0xC0000005: Infraccin de acceso al escribir en la ubicacin 0x0000000000030c28.

data.title: EDITING:: Extreme memory inefficiencies in the update_tree function (when loading a scene)?
data.body:
Supposedly I found that Godot starts throwing _out of memory_ errors and fails to load the tree setup when a scene file gets to where it contains a thousand or so nodes (including the nodes contained with scene instances).

Case in point
![godot_errors](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10081256/8814594/ec323864-2fd3-11e5-9a3b-275b217ade36.jpg)

There's a problem though, this error is on a machine with 16 gigabytes of RAM and I would think the engine can load up a few thousand nodes within that amount of space. Otherwise it could be a potential turnoff as people will find Godot unable to handle anything more than a somewhat small level size.

I've already tried reducing the net number of scene instances surrounding the spikes, but got the same result. The July 3 build of Godot meanwhile manages to load the tree, but prevents you from doing anything with it.

I hope this is something that can be resolved on Godot's side, as proper handling of large numbers of objects is a must for a modern game engine.

data.title: Can't play two different sounds at the same time with one SamplePlayer
data.body:
SamplePlayer has SampleLibrary with two sounds.

It's fine if play one sound with multiple times.
But, it only plays first one when try to play two different sounds at the same time.

I made a sample project for it.

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0ByuhCIzeus36MEIwYTR1TDRnTnc/view?usp=sharing
